properties.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 31 at 5:27PM CST by NWS Bismarck ND
properties.description:
Rises continue to be observed on the Missouri River in the Hoge
Island area early this evening from ice effects. With the arrival
of warmer air this afternoon, and milder conditions forecast for
Wednesday, ice will likely start to erode in the Square Butte
Creek, Ponderosa and Hoge Island areas over the next 12 to 24
hours. This will cause an eventual decrease in water levels.

Those with interests along the Missouri River should continue to
pay close attention to river conditions, as cycles of ice
formation and ice loss will continue to cause fluctuating water
levels over the coming days.
